update_flow.update_available_text:
A new version ({{latestVersion}}) is available. Please, update PersonaPlus to the latest version.

"Update" will redicert you the latest APK's download page.

"Changelog" will take you the release's GitHub page to see a summary of what's new.
update_flow.youre_maybe_up_to_date: Couldn't check the repository. You may or may not be up to date.
update_flow.cant_check_if_youre_up_to_date: Couldn't check if there are new updates. Please, try again later (or manually check the repository).
update_flow.failed_to_check: Failed to check for updates. Please try again later (or manually check the repo).

developer.description: Enables access to advanced developer info, useful for testing and contribution purposes.

danger_zone.subheader: Delete ALL data (profile, objectives, stats...) from PersonaPlus. There's no way to undo this or to recover your data. Not recommended, unless you're using PersonaPlus for testing purposes.

danger_zone_flow.title: Are you sure?
danger_zone_flow.subtitle: Again: THERE - IS - NO - WAY - BACK.

specific_errors.lang_react_error: Got a React error trying to change language!

header.label: Let's do it!
header.sublabel: The building blocks for a better you

questions.what_to_do: What do you want to do?
questions.when_to_do: What days do you want to exercise?
questions.when_to_do_protip:
Tap each day to enable/disable it.
Colored days are enabled, gray ones are disabled.
questions.how_many_pushups_protip: Tip: Balance the duration and number of push-ups. More push-ups in less time will be harder but have a greater effect on your body. Fewer push-ups over more time will provide a more relaxed and beginner-friendly session.
questions.how_many_lifts: How many lifts will you make?
questions.how_many_lifts_protip: Tip: Balance the duration and number of lifts. More lifts in less time will be harder but have a greater effect on your body. Fewer lifts over more time will provide a more relaxed and beginner-friendly session.
questions.how_much_does_the_lift_weight: How much does the lift weight?
questions.how_much_does_the_lift_weight_protip: In kilograms. If you're not sure: you know there are two weights or "things that weigh" on each side of your scale, right? Enter how much does each one of them weigh (assuming you know both should weigh the same)
questions.how_much_does_the_bar_weight: How much does the bar weight?
questions.amount_of_hands_protip_scales: Basically: are you going to workout with 1 scale or with 2 scales, one on each hand? Deaults to two.
questions.amount_of_hands_protip_pushup: Basically: are you going to push-up yourself using both hands (normal) or just one of them (advanced)? Defaults to two.
questions.what_speed_youll_run: What speed will you run to?
questions.what_speed_youll_run_protip: Of course you don't need to be exact, just try to estimate it.

too_much.text: Your current choice would equal {{equal}} minutes of exercise. Isn't that too much?
too_much.subtext: You can still create your objective, don't worry. We're just warning you, for your own health!

subpage_create_active_objective.required: Required: Duration, Exercise, and at least one day of the week. Specific exercises may have their own extra required fields: for example "Lifting" requires you to specify how much weight you'll be lifting.

help_section.Push Up:
To do a regular push-up, begin in a plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position. Keep your core engaged throughout for stability. Start with a comfortable number of repetitions and gradually increase as you build strength.

To do a one handed push-up, begin in a plank position with one hand centered beneath your shoulder and the other behind your back. Lower your body by bending your elbow until your chest nearly touches the floor, then push back up. Keep your core tight and maintain balance throughout the movement. Start with a few reps on each side and progress as your strength improves.
help_section.Lifting:
Distribute evenly the weights between both hands. For example, if your objective is to lift 6kg, put 3kg to each weight (as you'll lift two weights, one for each hand).

Without dropping it, extend your arm vertically, and start moving it up and down, making your elbow go from a 90ยบ angle to a 45ยบ angle and then again to a 90ยบ one (that would count as one lift).

Keep going until you do all the lifts specified (or the timer runs out)!
help_section.Running: To start running, ensure you have comfortable running shoes and attire. Begin with a warm-up by walking briskly for 5-10 minutes to prepare your muscles. Start running at a pace that feels comfortable, and maintain a steady breathing pattern. Focus on keeping a good posture and staying relaxed. If you're a beginner, alternate between running and walking in intervals. Gradually increase your running time as your endurance improves. Cool down by walking for a few minutes and then stretching.
help_section.Walking: Wear comfortable shoes and clothing suitable for the weather. Begin by walking at a natural pace, allowing your arms to swing naturally at your sides. Focus on maintaining a good posture, with your back straight and your head up. You can vary your speed, incorporating brisk walking intervals to increase your heart rate. Walking can be done almost anywhere, so choose a route you enjoy. Aim for at least 30 minutes of walking per session, and gradually increase your duration and intensity as you build stamina.
help_section.Meditation: Find a quiet and comfortable place to sit or lie down. Close your eyes and take a few deep breaths, focusing on the sensation of the air entering and leaving your body. Begin to observe your thoughts and feelings without judgment, letting them come and go naturally. You can focus on your breath, a mantra, or simply the present moment. If your mind wanders, gently bring your attention back to your focal point. Start with a few minutes and gradually extend your meditation time as you become more comfortable with the practice.

page_sessions.give_up_description: You are doing GREAT! Are you sure you want to give up? Your progress will be lost! (You can always start over if you change your mind)
page_sessions.timer_paused_help: Psst... Don't worry, we'e stopped the timer so you can read.

page_welcome.subtitle: We're proud to see you want to give yourself a plus!

fragment_one.title: Tell us about you
fragment_one.subtitle: We only ask for required data for the app to function and it never, ever, leaves your device.

fragment_two.title: What's your key goal?
fragment_two.subtitle: We know you want to improve yourself, but, what's your key priority?
fragment_two.subsubtitle: Choose only one option. No worries, you can always change it later from your profile.

options.exercising: Exercising: I gotta move my body ASAP!
options.eating: Diet: I should control a bit better what I eat.
options.wellbeing: Wellbeing: I want to take care of my mental health and digital wellbeing.
options.noprior: Everything is a top priority to me!
options.nopriorwithassist: I don't know / I can't decide on one

fragment_three.title: Tell us about your habits
fragment_three.subtitle: Understanding your life will help us help you improve it.

sleeping.asks: How much do you sleep each night? It doesn't have to be exact

activness.asks: How active are you? This means, how often do you exercise or do other physical activities? It doesn't have to be exact.
activness.small: A little active (1-2 days per week)
activness.intense: Highly active (more than 5 days or intense workouts)
activness.super: Extremely active (daily or multiple times a day, very intense)

subpage_edit_profile.title: Update your profile
subpage_edit_profile.subtitle: Life changes and so do you.

results.body_running: You were running at about {{speed}} for {{time}} minutes`

page_session_results.well_done_bud: Well done, bud. The results of this session will be saved, togheter with your results from other sessions.

project.subheader: It's clear: an app designed to help you give yourself more and have a better life through help and hard work.

creator.subheader: PersonaPlus is an independent app made by myself (Zaka). However, it is an open source project, you can contribute to it's code (and get your name here!).

about_page.testing: Psst... You're currently in the "pre-app" stage - the earliest early versions of the app! Thanks for being part of the testing version, it means a lot. Don't forget to report any issues you find!

all_done: Feel proud of yourself, don't you?
That is right, you have completed ALL of your objectives for today.
Now plan something else and make this day even more productive!
"Giving yourself a PLUS" seems to be worth it, right?
Take a moment to celebrate your accomplishments!
All tasks checked off! Well done, keep up the momentum.
Another productive day in the books. Great job!
Mission accomplished! What's next on your list?
Not enough? You can go to your dashboard and add something else.
Who could tell a phone app could help you get so much done?
add objective -> acomplish it -> feel good -> repeat
bro finally got out his cave
For today; objectives due tomorrow aren't shown ;)
session_done: Bro's actually giving himself a plus, great!
Nothing's funnier than giving yourself a plus, right?
AND HIS NAME HIS JOHN CENA *trumpet plays*
You gave yourself a plus, now give yourself a break
"Growing myself, one session at a time"
There's still time for another one ;]
reminders: You know you got stuff to do!
Daily objective means DAILY objective - go and do it!
Time to give yourself a plus!
You said you wanted to give yourself a plus - get up!
The difference between PersonaPlus and a regular task list? I'm way more fun to check!
I'm like your mom: I won't stop till' you make it.
Give yourself a plus before, mute your phone after.
The only notification that doesn't make you waste time.
No, not another TikTok notification this time. Move yourself, damnit!
No, not another Instagram notification. I'll make you a better person, reels wont!
They're called 'objectives' for a reason: you have to accomplish them!
No, I won't stop sending notifications until you stop ignoring your path to success
Trust me, you'll feel better later.
just one more session pls, love u <3
You downloaded this app for a reason. Don't give it up.

globals.workinprogress: PersonaPlus is still an app in early development. Many features, like this one, aren't yet available. Soon they'll be! Don't forget to check every few weeks for new updates.
globals.error_loading_content: There was an error loading this content. Sorry!

logs.not_exported: There was an error saving the file: {{err}}
logs.clear_warning: Logs are very useful in case you get an error, especially now that the app is still in a testing version. However, for privacy, we do allow removing them. Do it at your own will.
